required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity of Wilate in Previously Treated Paediatric Patients With Severe Haemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity of Wilate in Previously Treated Paediatric Patients With Severe Haemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, non-controlled, international, multi-centre phase 3 study to investigate the pharmacokinetics, efficacy, safety, and immunogenicity of Wilate in previously treated children with severe haemophilia A

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Area Under the Curve (AUC)) of FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate AUC is hours (h) x international units (IU)/decilitre (dL).

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Area Under the Curve [AUC] Normalised (AUCNorm)) of FVIII:C for Wilate
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The mean area under the curve normalised for the administered dose (AUCnorm) was calculated for Wilate. The units of measure used were AUC divided by dose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate half-life is hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Maximum Plasma Concentration) for FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of FVIII:C were determined using the one-stage (OS) assays. The maximum plasma concentration of FVIII:C was calculated based on the FVIII:C values measured in the patients participating in the PK study. Units of measure for maximum plasma concentration are international units (IU)/ decilitre (dL)

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax)) of FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate Tmax is hours (h).

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Mean Residence Time (MRT)) of FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate MRT is hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Assessment (Volume of Distribution (Vd)) of FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate Vd is decilitre (dL)/ kilograms (kg).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0h, 0.25h, 1h, 6h, 24h and 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: PK assessments of the factor VIII coagulant activity (FVIII:C) for Wilate were determined using the one-stage (OS) assay. The units of measure to calculate clearance are decilitre (dL)/ hours (h)/ kilograms (kg).

primary_outcome.measure: Incremental In Vivo Recovery (IVR) of FVIII:C
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 h following a single dose of Wilate
primary_outcome.description: The incremental IVR was determined from all patients at baseline was determined using the one-stage (OS) assay (standardised to 50 IU/kg). The units of measure to calculate IVR is kilograms (kg) / deciliter (dL)

secondary_outcome.description: The total number of bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of TABR.

The SABR was calculated in analogy to the TABR. The total number of spontaneous bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of the SABR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Wilate in the Treatment of Breakthrough Bleeding Events (BEs)
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of BEs successfully treated with Wilate was assessed by the patient (together with the investigator in case of on-site treatment) in a patient diary. The treatment efficacy for all BEs was assessed using a pre-defined four-point scale: 'excellent', 'good', 'moderate', 'none'. 'Excellent' was defined as "Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single injection" (best outcome); 'good 'was defined as "definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8-12 hours after an injection, requiring up to 2 injections for complete resolution". All efficacy ratings assessed as either 'excellent' or 'good' were considered 'successfully treated'. 'Moderate' was defined as "probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first injection" and 'none' defined as "no improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms".

secondary_outcome.measure: Wilate Consumption Data: Average Dose of Wilate Per Week of Study
secondary_outcome.description: The average consumption of Wilate per week of the study (IU/kg) for all patients receiving prophylaxis

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental in Vivo Recovery (IVR) of Wilate Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 3 and 6 months of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The rise in FVIII:C activity in IU/dl per unit dose administered in IU/kg was determined for all patients at baseline, 3 and 6 months, using the one-stage (OS) assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association Between ABO Blood Type and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate (OS Assay)
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between the ABO blood type and the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association Between VWF:Ag Concentration and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between VWF:Ag with the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Wilate by Monitoring The Number of Adverse Events (AEs) Throughout the Study
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit (whether scheduled or unscheduled) , AEs will be documented by the investigator throughout the study. In addition, the investigator will check the patient diaries for any documented event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity of Wilate: Number of Participants With FVIII Inhibitor Activity at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: FVIII inhibitor activity was determined at each study visit: screening, PK, Day 14 visit, Day 30 visit, 3 Months visit and 6 Months visit before injection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Virus Safety Measured by the Number With Parvovirus B19 Seroconversions Between Baseline (BL) and End of Study
secondary_outcome.description: Virus safety was evaluated by taking a plasma sample for parvovirus B19 antibody testing before the first injection of Wilate at the PK visit. All patients negative at screening were tested again at the Study Completion visit. The number of Parvovirus B19 seroconversions between BL and end of study was recorded

arm_group.description: All patients will receive Wilate for prophylactic treatment. Patients will also receive Wilate for treatment of breakthrough bleeding events as required

intervention.description: von Willebrand factor / Factor VIII (plasma derived)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Severe haemophilia A (<1% FVIII:C) according to medical history
2. Male patients aged 1 to <12 years
3. Previous treatment with a FVIII concentrate for at least 50 exposure days (EDs)
4. Immunocompetence (CD4+ count >200/μL)
5. Voluntarily given, fully informed written and signed consent obtained by the patient's parent(s) or legal guardian and, depending on the children's developmental stage and intellectual capacity, informed assent by the patients before any study-related procedures are performed
The interval between the Screening Visit and the PK Visit should not exceed 30 days. If the 30-day interval is exceeded, determination of the CD4+ count is to be repeated and must be >200/μL for patients to be enrolled (i.e., inclusion criterion no. 4).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any coagulation disorders other than haemophilia A
2. History of FVIII inhibitor activity (≥0.6 BU) or detectable FVIII inhibitory antibodies (≥0.6 BU using the Nijmegen modification of the Bethesda assay) at screening, as determined by the central laboratory
3. Severe liver or kidney diseases (alanine aminotransferase [ALAT] and aspartate transaminase [ASAT] levels >5 times of upper limit of normal, creatinine >120 μmol/L)
4. Patients receiving or scheduled to receive immunomodulating drugs (other than antiretroviral chemotherapy), such as alpha-interferon, prednisone (equivalent to >10 mg/day), or similar drugs

group.title: Wilate
group.description: A total of 11 patients were enrolled in this study. For the pharmacokinetic (PK) assessment a single dose of Wilate (50±5 IU/kg BW) was administered to 10 patients. Prophylactic treatment: Wilate (20–40 IU/kg BW) was administered every 2–3 days for 6 months. In case of unacceptably frequent spontaneous breakthrough bleeding episodes (BEs) the dose of Wilate was to be increased by approximately 5 IU/kg. The dose (and duration) of treatment for breakthrough BEs was dependent on the location and extent of bleeding and on the clinical condition of the patient; range: 10–50 IU/kg every 12–24 hours or 8–24 hours until resolved. Two patients underwent surgery treated with Wilate (SURG population). Minor surgeries received 15–30 IU/kg of Wilate every 24 hours until healing was achieved. Major surgeries were treated with 40–50 IU/kg, repeat injection every 8–24 hours until adequate wound healing, then therapy for at least another 7 days to maintain a FVIII activity of 30% to 60%.

baseline.population: The safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10).

group.title: Wilate
group.description: The safety (SAF) population includes all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10).

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: Age at screening (years)
measure.population: The overall safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10). Of these, 5 patients aged 1–<6 years were analyzed, and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years were analyzed.

measure.title: Sex/Gender, Customized
measure.population: The overall safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10). Of these, 5 patients 1–<6 years were analyzed, and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years were analyzed.

measure.description: Previous ABR is based on the bleeding rate in the 6 months prior to entry into the study.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the PK population which included all patients who underwent PK assessment during the study (total: n=10). The PK population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years.

outcome.title: Total Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR)
outcome.description: The total number of bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of TABR.
outcome.population: This analysis was performed for the full-analysis (FAS) population which included all patients who has at least one injection of Wilate (n=10). The FAS population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years.

measure.title: Total Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR)
measure.description: The total number of bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of TABR.
measure.population: This analysis was performed for the full-analysis (FAS) population which included all patients who has at least one injection of Wilate (n=10). The FAS population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years.

outcome.title: Spontaneous Annualized Bleeding Rate (SABR)
outcome.description: The SABR was calculated in analogy to the TABR. The total number of spontaneous bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of the SABR.
outcome.population: This analysis was performed for the full-analysis (FAS) population which included all patients who has at least one injection of Wilate (n=10). The FAS population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years.

measure.title: Spontaneous Annualized Bleeding Rate (SABR)
measure.description: The SABR was calculated in analogy to the TABR. The total number of spontaneous bleeding events (BEs) in the time period between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit, divided by the duration (in years) between the first dose of IMP and the study completion visit. Surgery periods, and BEs occurring within these periods, will be excluded from the calculation of the SABR.
measure.population: This analysis was performed for the full-analysis (FAS) population which included all patients who has at least one injection of Wilate (n=10). The FAS population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years.

outcome.title: Efficacy of Wilate in the Treatment of Breakthrough Bleeding Events (BEs)
outcome.description: The proportion of BEs successfully treated with Wilate was assessed by the patient (together with the investigator in case of on-site treatment) in a patient diary. The treatment efficacy for all BEs was assessed using a pre-defined four-point scale: 'excellent', 'good', 'moderate', 'none'. 'Excellent' was defined as "Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single injection" (best outcome); 'good 'was defined as "definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8-12 hours after an injection, requiring up to 2 injections for complete resolution". All efficacy ratings assessed as either 'excellent' or 'good' were considered 'successfully treated'. 'Moderate' was defined as "probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first injection" and 'none' defined as "no improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms".
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in the per-protocol (PP) population. Of the patients in the PP population, only 8 patients had evaluable bleeding events. Five of these patients were aged 1–<6 years, and 3 aged 6–<12 years.

The treatment efficacy for all BEs was assessed using a pre-defined four-point scale: 'excellent', 'good', 'moderate', 'none'. 'Excellent' was defined as "Abrupt pain relief and/or unequivocal improvement in objective signs of bleeding within approximately 8 hours after a single injection" (best outcome); 'good 'was defined as "definite pain relief and/or improvement in signs of bleeding within approximately 8-12 hours after an injection, requiring up to 2 injections for complete resolution". All efficacy ratings assessed as either 'excellent' or 'good' were considered 'successfully treated'. 'Moderate' was defined as "probable or slight beneficial effect within approximately 12 hours after the first injection" and 'none' defined as "no improvement within 12 hours, or worsening of symptoms".

outcome.description: The rise in FVIII:C activity in IU/dl per unit dose administered in IU/kg was determined for all patients at baseline, 3 and 6 months, using the one-stage (OS) assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, and 3 and 6 months of treatment
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the full analysis (FAS) population (total: n=10). The FAS comprised 5 patients were aged 1–<6 years and 5 were aged 6–<12 years.

group.title: 1–<6 Years
group.description: All patients in the FAS population aged 1–<6 years.

group.title: 6–<12 Years
group.description: All patients in the FAS population aged 6–<12 years.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total patients in the FAS population

measure.title: Incremental in Vivo Recovery (IVR) of Wilate Over Time
measure.description: The rise in FVIII:C activity in IU/dl per unit dose administered in IU/kg was determined for all patients at baseline, 3 and 6 months, using the one-stage (OS) assay.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the full analysis (FAS) population (total: n=10). The FAS comprised 5 patients were aged 1–<6 years and 5 were aged 6–<12 years.

outcome.title: Association Between ABO Blood Type and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate (OS Assay)
outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between the ABO blood type and the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed for the PK population which included all patients who underwent PK assessment during the study (total: n=10). The PK population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 aged 6–<12 years.

measure.title: Association Between ABO Blood Type and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate (OS Assay)
measure.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between the ABO blood type and the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.
measure.population: The analysis was performed for the PK population which included all patients who underwent PK assessment during the study (total: n=10). The PK population comprised 5 patients aged 1–<6 years and 5 aged 6–<12 years.

outcome.title: Association Between VWF:Ag Concentration and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate
outcome.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between VWF:Ag with the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed for the PK population which included all patients who underwent PK assessment during the study (total: n=10).

measure.title: Association Between VWF:Ag Concentration and the FVIII:C Half-life of Wilate
measure.description: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used in an exploratory sense to assess a possible association between VWF:Ag with the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate. This was analysed by calculating the mean square in a one-stage (OS) assay.
measure.population: The analysis was performed for the PK population which included all patients who underwent PK assessment during the study (total: n=10).

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability of Wilate by Monitoring The Number of Adverse Events (AEs) Throughout the Study
outcome.description: At each visit (whether scheduled or unscheduled) , AEs will be documented by the investigator throughout the study. In addition, the investigator will check the patient diaries for any documented event.
outcome.population: The safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10).

measure.title: Safety and Tolerability of Wilate by Monitoring The Number of Adverse Events (AEs) Throughout the Study
measure.description: At each visit (whether scheduled or unscheduled) , AEs will be documented by the investigator throughout the study. In addition, the investigator will check the patient diaries for any documented event.
measure.population: The safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10).

outcome.title: Immunogenicity of Wilate: Number of Participants With FVIII Inhibitor Activity at 6 Months
outcome.description: FVIII inhibitor activity was determined at each study visit: screening, PK, Day 14 visit, Day 30 visit, 3 Months visit and 6 Months visit before injection.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the overall safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10). Of these, 5 patients 1–<6 years were analyzed, and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years were analyzed.

measure.title: Immunogenicity of Wilate: Number of Participants With FVIII Inhibitor Activity at 6 Months
measure.description: FVIII inhibitor activity was determined at each study visit: screening, PK, Day 14 visit, Day 30 visit, 3 Months visit and 6 Months visit before injection.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the overall safety (SAF) population included all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10). Of these, 5 patients 1–<6 years were analyzed, and 5 patients aged 6–<12 years were analyzed.

outcome.title: Virus Safety Measured by the Number With Parvovirus B19 Seroconversions Between Baseline (BL) and End of Study
outcome.description: Virus safety was evaluated by taking a plasma sample for parvovirus B19 antibody testing before the first injection of Wilate at the PK visit. All patients negative at screening were tested again at the Study Completion visit. The number of Parvovirus B19 seroconversions between BL and end of study was recorded
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in all patients who underwent full analysis (FAS population) (n=10).

measure.title: Virus Safety Measured by the Number With Parvovirus B19 Seroconversions Between Baseline (BL) and End of Study
measure.description: Virus safety was evaluated by taking a plasma sample for parvovirus B19 antibody testing before the first injection of Wilate at the PK visit. All patients negative at screening were tested again at the Study Completion visit. The number of Parvovirus B19 seroconversions between BL and end of study was recorded
measure.population: Analysis was performed in all patients who underwent full analysis (FAS population) (n=10).

reported_events.time_frame: Between the screening visit and the follow up contact visit (30 days after the 6-month study completion visit)

group.title: Wilate
group.description: The safety (SAF) population includes all patients who received at least one injection of Wilate during the study (n=10).

event.description: One patient had a treatment emergent adverse event (TEAE) that was classified as serious because it required hospitalisation for surgery. The adverse event was judged as moderate and not related to Wilate.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
